questions.question: What is the time complexity of inserting an element at the beginning of an array?
questions.explanation: Inserting at the beginning requires shifting all existing elements, making it O(n).

questions.question: Which data structure follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle?
questions.explanation: Stack follows LIFO principle where the last element added is the first one to be removed.

questions.question: What is the worst-case time complexity of Quick Sort?
questions.explanation: Quick Sort has O(n²) worst-case complexity when the pivot is always the smallest or largest element.

questions.question: In a binary search tree, what is the time complexity of searching for an element in the average case?
questions.explanation: In a balanced BST, search operation takes O(log n) time in average case.

questions.question: Which algorithm is used to find the shortest path between all pairs of vertices?
questions.explanation: Floyd-Warshall algorithm finds shortest paths between all pairs of vertices.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a data warehouse?
questions.explanation: Data warehouse is designed for analytical processing and business intelligence activities.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of OLAP systems?
questions.explanation: OLAP systems are optimized for analytical queries, not high-volume transactions (which is OLTP).

questions.question: What does ETL stand for in data warehousing?
questions.explanation: ETL stands for Extract, Transform, Load - the process of moving data from source to destination.

questions.question: Which type of dimension changes over time and maintains historical data?
questions.explanation: Type 2 Slowly Changing Dimension maintains complete historical data by creating new records.

questions.question: Which type of machine learning algorithm learns from labeled training data?
questions.explanation: Supervised learning uses labeled training data to learn the mapping from input to output.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of k-means clustering?
questions.explanation: K-means clustering groups data points into k clusters based on similarity.

questions.question: Which activation function is commonly used in hidden layers of neural networks?
questions.explanation: ReLU (Rectified Linear Unit) is widely used in hidden layers due to its computational efficiency and ability to mitigate vanishing gradient problem.

questions.question: What does overfitting mean in machine learning?
options: Model performs well on both training and test data
Model performs poorly on training data
Model performs well on training but poorly on test data
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns the training data too well, including noise, leading to poor generalization.

questions.question: Which algorithm is used for dimensionality reduction?
questions.explanation: PCA is a popular technique for reducing the number of dimensions while preserving important information.
